summary: This function creates an iterable whose iterator can iterate over the given data-structure.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Create a new array. %0A    val array = F::newArray((class int), 5) is int[];%0A%0A    # Compute the length of the array. %0A    val length = F::len(array);%0A%0A    # Print the length of the array. %0A    F::println(%22Length = %22 .. length);%0A%0A    # Set the values of the elements in the array.%0A    F::set(array, 0, 10);%0A    F::set(array, 1, 20);%0A    F::set(array, 2, 30);%0A    F::set(array, 3, 40);%0A    F::set(array, 4, 50);%0A%0A    # Create a view of the array.%0A    val view = F::iter(array);%0A%0A    # Print the aforesaid values. %0A    foreach (value : Object in view)%0A    {%0A        F::println(value);%0A    }%0A}
